operations.target_text: All requests will be sent by email to <email>
operations.replacement: All requests will be submitted through system custom
operations.comment: You indicated using a custom ticketing system for access requests. Ticketing system = proper audit trails and tracking; Email = simple but no tracking; Chat = fast but informal.

You selected a custom review frequency instead of quarterly basis. We recommend quarterly reviews for most companies. If you operate in highly critical industries with complex or large company structure (1000+ employees), you might consider monthly reviews. Small companies and startups can get away with annual reviews. Pick any frequency that works for your company. Auditors only care that you consistently follow whatever schedule you document here.

You selected a custom termination timeframe instead of 24 business hours. We recommend 24 business hours for most companies. Consider shorter timelines if customers request it. Longer than 1 week looks suspicious to auditors. You only get a non-conformity for not meeting your documented timeframe, not for choosing the wrong timeframe.

You indicated that pod policy is the owner of this access control policy, so the owner placeholder needs to be replaced. This person is the enforcer of the policy. If your employees have questions about the policy, that person should be easily identified by employees and prepared to answer any of their questions regarding the policy.

You indicated that the HR Manager is responsible for approving exceptions to this policy, so the IT Manager placeholder should be updated. Can be the same person as violations reporting section. Acceptable roles: CISO, CEO, CTO, IT Manager, or even HR Manager. For audit it's only important to define it. Auditors will not issue a non-conformity for wrong selection - select what works best for you here. But it needs to be consistently done by this person.
